tweet: We discussed the Future Loggers Career Act, which allows youth to learn the logging trade under parental supervision, and the DRIVE-Safe Act, which creates an apprenticeship program allowing 18-to 21-year-old CDL holders to legally operate a commercial vehicle over state lines.

On this month’s edition of #InsideMaine, @RepGolden and Brian Parke, CEO of Maine Motor Transport Association join me to discuss legislative efforts to encourage young people to pursue careers like logging and trucking. Listen here: https://www.king.senate.gov/newsroom/inside-maine-podcast …

Everywhere I go in Maine I hear the same thing from businesses large and small: they need qualified workers. It’s critical to Maine’s future that our young people have strong career opportunities, and that businesses in Maine have access to a pool of talented employees.

It feels like the administration is stuck in a loop, always returning to their efforts to dismantle the ACA. If there is one bright spot in this awful proposal, it’s that I can’t imagine Congress will support these cuts – the programs are simply too important to too many Americans. When the Senate begins its budgeting process, I’ll fight hard to continue funding Special Olympics.

According to @SpecialOMaine, these proposed cuts would hurt nearly 3,000 Maine students who participate in the Unified Champion Schools, a program focused on creating inclusive school communities for individuals with ID. That’s unacceptable, and incongruent with our values.

The @SpecialOlympics are the best of us: communities coming together to support people with intellectual disabilities. Anyone who feels this isn’t a priority worth supporting in the federal budget has a different view of America than I do. https://www.si.com/olympics/2019/03/26/betsy-devos-defends-department-education-cuts-special-olympics-funding-proposal …

The award Travis received is awarded based on courage and sacrifice; commitment and integrity; citizenship and patriotism. I can’t imagine a more deserving recipient than Travis. Congratulations, @ssgtravismills, and keep working – you’re making a difference.

Through the Travis Mills Foundation, Travis has been able to share his relentless positivity and incredible determination with so many of our nation’s heroes and their families. Quite simply – every single day, they make the world a better place.

I don’t know that I’ve ever met a more inspiring person than @ssgtravismills, so it was an absolute honor to join the @CMOHfoundation this week to award him 2019 Act of Service Award as recognition for his work for wounded veterans. pic.twitter.com/X7xqCLNgZu

Healthcare isn’t a privilege that can be revoked from those who are too poor or too sick – it’s a prerequisite for anyone seeking a happy, healthy, productive life. We should be working to build on the work of the Affordable Care Act, not continually trying to tear it down.

By requiring the IRS to publish the identity of donors who give $5,000 or more to political organizations, the SUN Act would shed light on dark money and secretive donors – an important step toward the American ideal that no one vote is worth more than another.

The Framers sought to create a government that is of, by, and for the people – and the foundation of that government is elections that are free, fair, and representative of the American people. To increase election transparency, I cosponsored the SUN Act.  https://www.king.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/king-cosponsors-legislation-to-increase-transparency-in-political-donations …

Starting today, the Bangor Taxpayer Assistance Center will be reopened on Wednesdays and Thursdays to help Maine people during this tax season. The service is only available by appointments, so call 844-545-5640 to make an appointment during the available windows.

Important update – after my letter with @SenatorCollins and @RepGolden, Maine people looking for tax assistance in the Bangor area will once again be able to access support to navigate the new tax law. https://bangordailynews.com/2019/03/19/news/bangor/irs-to-reopen-bangor-taxpayer-assistance-center-wednesday/ …

The closure of Bangor's Taxpayer Advocate Center inconveniences thousands of Maine people, forcing some to travel hundreds of miles for tax assistance. I joined @RepGolden and @SenatorCollins in urging the IRS to permanently reopen and staff this location. pic.twitter.com/ZJKbDH3ZDZ

The Constitution’s division of powers is clear: presidents don’t get to substitute their spending priorities for those of the Congress. Logging is a vital supporter of Maine’s rural communities and a key driver of the regional economy. By allowing interested young Maine people to learn on the job with their families, we can strengthen our forest products industry and help this industry continue to succeed.

Logging is more than just an occupation in Maine – it’s a tradition that has been passed down through generations. That’s why @RepGolden and I have introduced a bipartisan, bicameral bill to help train the next generation of loggers. https://bangordailynews.com/2019/03/18/politics/angus-king-jared-golden-introducing-bill-to-get-teenagers-involved-in-logging/ …

Travis now runs the Travis Mills Foundation, using his platform and his voice to help wounded veterans and their families heal. With his indomitable spirit and incredible courage, I can’t imagine there could be a more deserving recipient of this award.
I’ve met a lot of people throughout my life, but Travis stands out as one of – if not the – most inspiring and positive people I’ve ever come across.

These awards recognize Americans whose exceptional courage and selfless service embody the values of the Congressional Medal of Honor: courage and sacrifice; commitment and integrity; citizenship and patriotism. That’s Travis.
Proud to join the @CMOHfoundation today to announce that Maine’s own @ssgtravismills is a finalist for the Congressional Medal Honor Society’s 2019 Citizen Honors Awards. pic.twitter.com/XnbGoSbljt

We've heard about unacceptable on-base living conditions from servicemembers, including mold contamination and pest infestations, at some installations. In a Senate hearing today, I pressed officials to ensure that servicemembers and their families have access to quality housing. pic.twitter.com/EdygiRFskD

That’s not how this is supposed to work. Let’s come together, cut through the bureaucracy, and make sure our friends and neighbors have the tools they need to prevent serious injuries and remain in their homes.

There are a number of well-intentioned federal programs that are supposed to make it easier for seniors and individuals with disabilities to stay in their homes – so many programs, in fact, that it can be hard for these individuals to understand and access this assistance.

If you ask seniors or individuals with disabilities where they’d like to live, the vast majority will deliver a simple and clear answer: ‘at home.’ So let’s help them do that. That’s why today, I introduced the Senior and Disability Home Modification Assistance Initiative Act.

There is no tool more important to success in the 21st century economy than the open internet. That’s why I’ve joined my colleagues to introduce the 'Save the Internet' Act, which would fully restore #NetNeutrality rules and make sure the internet remains a level playing field. pic.twitter.com/rQYxAD1bCh

It’s always great to see these folks on their yearly trek to DC, but this time, they were missing a friendly face: Pete Miesburger, who passed away in November. The members of Maine’s VFW took on the challenge of defending our nation and our freedom – they deserve our immense respect, and we must give every effort to serve them. A pleasure to host them in D.C. this week. pic.twitter.com/dPlKLjzzYN

Since he does not believe that a patient with a pre-existing condition deserves access to healthcare, I do not believe he deserves to be seated as a United States judge, and I will vote ‘no’ on his nomination.
In a line of unqualified or unfit judicial nominees over the last two years, Mr. Readler’s candidacy stands out as particularly concerning to me.

Unfortunately, the administration’s latest nominee, Chad Readler, doesn’t agree – in fact, he was the at the forefront of the effort to dismantle the Affordable Care Act’s protections for those with pre-existing conditions.
Healthcare isn’t a privilege that can be revoked if you’re too poor or too sick; it is a right, and every American should be able to rely on that right in order to lead a happy, healthy life.

The States Achieve Medicaid Expansion (SAME) Act will ensure that Maine has access to the SAME benefits it would have received had it expanded in 2014 – it’s commonsense and will create more affordable coverage for over 70,000 Maine people. READ MORE:  https://www.king.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/king-backs-bill-to-maximize-medicaid-expansion-benefits-for-maine …

Maine people have made it clear: they want Medicaid expansion. While Maine’s government processes this at the state level, I've cosponsored a bill to keep fighting to ensure Maine receives the same federal benefits it would have received if our state expanded Medicaid earlier.
